int pri_parse_cmdline ( int  pc_argc,
char *  pc_argv[] 
)

Function:
pri_parse_cmdline
Description:
Parse command line arguments supplied to the P3 Primary application.
Inputs:
  • pc_argc: Number of arguments
  • pc_argv: Argument vector
Outputs:
  • int: Status
    • 0 = OK
    • <0 = Error
    • >0 = Informational

int pri_parse_config (  ) 

Function:
pri_parse_config
Description:
Parse the P3 Primary configuration file. If there are errors with individual definitions, parsing continues but an error status is returned. This allows as many errors as possible to be detected in a single parsing of the configuration file.
Inputs:
  • None
Outputs:
  • int: Status
    • 0 = OK
    • <0 = Error

References _p3sechostcfg::addr, _p3primarycfg::addr, _p3primarycfg::array_size, _p3pri_main::cfg_data, _p3sechostcfg::citime, _p3pri_main::cluster, _p3pri_main::config, _p3primarycfg::ctlidx_wait, _p3primarycfg::datidx_wait, _p3sechostcfg::ditime, _p3sechostcfg::flag, _p3pri_main::flag, _p3cluster::flag, _p3primarycfg::flag, getsubnetcfg(), _p3sechostcfg::hb_fail, _p3primarycfg::hb_fail, _p3sechostcfg::hb_wait, _p3primarycfg::hb_wait, _p3pri_main::home, _p3subnetcfg::id, isallnum(), line, LOCALEND, LOCALSTART, _p3util::lochost, _p3subnetcfg::mask, _p3subnetcfg::net, _p3subnetcfg::next, NULL, p3buf, p3BUFSIZE, p3calloc, p3errmsg(), p3HST_ARRAY, p3HST_ID, p3HST_IPV4, p3HST_IPV6, p3HST_KTSHF, p3KTYPE_AES128, p3KTYPE_AES256, p3MSG_CRIT, p3MSG_DEBUG, p3MSG_ERR, p3PCFG_ARSZ, p3PCFG_CIWT, p3PCFG_DIWT, p3PCFG_HBFL, p3PCFG_HBWT, p3PCFG_RKWT, p3PRI_PORT, p3PRI_RNSHF, p3utils, PATH_SEPARATOR, _p3primarycfg::port, pri_init_config(), primarycfg, _p3primarycfg::rekey_wait, _p3util::remhost, _p3sechostcfg::rk_wait, send_ioctl(), _p3sechostcfg::subnets, _p3sechostcfg::subnetsz, update_sechost(), _p3subnetcfg::v4, _p3sechostcfg::v4, _p3util::v4, _p3primarycfg::v4, _p3subnetcfg::v6, _p3sechostcfg::v6, _p3util::v6, and _p3primarycfg::v6.

int update_sechost ( p3sechostcfg *  sechost  ) 

Function:
update_sechost
Description:
Build a remote secondary host definition to be sent to the kernel module in an ioctl buffer. The list of subnet configurations is freed as the command buffer is built.
Inputs:
  • sechost: The secondary host definition, which contains a list of subnets associated with it.
Outputs:
  • int: Status
    • 0 = OK
    • <0 = Error

References _p3subnetcfg::next, NULL, p3buf, p3errmsg(), p3malloc, p3MSG_CRIT, p3MSG_ERR, p3MSG_WARN, secondaryhostcfg, send_ioctl(), _p3sechostcfg::subnets, and _p3sechostcfg::subnetsz.

Referenced by pri_parse_config().
